intro: Geissorhiza minima, commonly known as the dwarf firecracker, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, thick rhizome. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a sought-after species among botanists and plant enthusiasts.
